perturbation.original_text:
All Parties agreed the payment listed below are fair and just for the services being provided. Payment
to the following individual below within 7 days upon completion and handover on the Project to VAL.
perturbation.changed_text:
All Parties agreed the payment listed below are fair and just for the services being provided. Payment
to the following individual below within 7 days upon completion and handover on the Project to VAL.
Notwithstanding the foregoing, VAL reserves the right to delay payment for up to 30 days pending a full audit of the delivered project.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces a contradiction. The original text states payment is due within 7 days. The added sentence allows VAL to delay payment up to 30 days for an audit, creating uncertainty about the actual payment deadline and potential disputes.

perturbation.original_text:
This Agreement will be for the maximum period of six (6) months beginning for the commencement
date, renewable in accordance with the terms hereof, unless earlier terminated pursuant to this
Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
This Agreement will be for the maximum period of six (6) months beginning for the commencement
date, renewable in accordance with the terms hereof, unless earlier terminated pursuant to this
Agreement.
Notwithstanding the preceding sentence, VAL, at its sole discretion, may extend the agreement for an additional three (3) months without requiring renewal or further consent from the Developer.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces a contradiction regarding the agreement period. The original text sets a maximum of six months unless renewed or terminated. The added sentence allows VAL to unilaterally extend it by three months, conflicting with the initial six-month limit and creating uncertainty for the Developer.

perturbation.original_text:
VAL shall, in the event of Developer committing any breach of any of the terms and conditions of this
agreement or for any other reason considered as sufficient, be entitled to terminate this agreement by
giving two (2) weeks’ notice in writing and it is applicable only when the project is not completed. If
the customer terminates the agreement, then VAL shall compensate the Developer up to the date of
termination with a fee calculated on Pro-rata basis. Developer may also terminate this Agreement by
giving two (2) weeks’ notice in writing to VAL. It is applicable only when the project is not completed.
In case Developer terminates the agreement, it shall handover the entire project related IPR, work
done till date to VAL.
perturbation.changed_text:
VAL shall, in the event of Developer committing any breach of any of the terms and conditions of this
agreement or for any other reason considered as sufficient, be entitled to terminate this agreement by
giving two (2) weeks’ notice in writing and it is applicable only when the project is not completed. If
the customer terminates the agreement, then VAL shall compensate the Developer up to the date of
termination with a fee calculated on Pro-rata basis. Developer may also terminate this Agreement by
giving two (2) weeks’ notice in writing to VAL. It is applicable only when the project is not completed.
In case Developer terminates the agreement, it shall handover the entire project related IPR, work
done till date to VAL.
Notwithstanding the forgoing, should VAL terminate this agreement due to the developer not completing a specified milestone on-time as per the defined timeline in clause 6.6, developer is not entitled to any compensation.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause 12.1 specifies pro-rata compensation to the developer if VAL terminates. The added text adds that compensation will be not given if the termination is due to milestones not being completed by the agreed schedule, creating a contradiction of the conditions under which the developer would receive compensation.
